Respect the personal boundaries of others by acknowledging and honoring the limits they set for themselves, whether explicit or implicit, to maintain their emotional, physical, and psychological well-being. This includes asking for consent, respecting decisions to decline engagement, being mindful of physical touch and space, and avoiding gossip or sharing sensitive information without permission.
Respect personal boundaries by obtaining explicit consent before sharing sensitive information, avoiding prying questions, and prioritizing individuals' emotional well-being.

Respect privacy and personal boundaries of others by being aware of and respecting explicit and subconscious cues, actively listening and asking for permission, and avoiding assumptions, intrusive questions, and pressure to disclose information without consent.

Avoid overreliance on appearance, and instead, consult field guides, take courses, and practice identification in controlled environments to ensure accurate recognition. Always err on the side of caution, and if in doubt, avoid consuming or handling the plant or animal altogether.
